Symptoms.Name: Overwhelming workload
Questions: Do you often feel overwhelmed by numerous assignments or tasks?
Do you struggle to balance coursework and other activities?
Symptoms.Advice: Try breaking tasks into smaller parts and setting achievable goals.

Symptoms.Name: Exam fear
Questions: Do you feel panicked or scared when thinking about exams?
Do you worry about disappointing your parents due to poor exam performance?
Symptoms.Advice: Practice relaxation techniques and focus on self-encouragement.

Symptoms.Name: Memory and comprehension issues
Questions: Do you find it hard to concentrate while studying?
Do you struggle to retain information after studying?
Symptoms.Advice: Develop a structured study plan and take regular breaks to improve focus.

Symptoms.Name: Social isolation
Questions: Do you feel disconnected from your classmates or friends?
Do you find it hard to communicate with others about your academic stress?
Symptoms.Advice: Participate in group activities or seek support from trusted friends or counselors.

Symptoms.Name: Procrastination
Questions: Do you find yourself delaying tasks until the last minute?
Do you struggle to start working on assignments or studying?
Symptoms.Advice: Create a fixed schedule and use time management techniques to avoid procrastination.

Symptoms.Name: Performance pressure
Questions: Do you feel constant pressure to excel academically?
Do you fear failing to meet your own or others' expectations?
Symptoms.Advice: Focus on setting realistic goals and prioritize self-care to reduce pressure.

Symptoms.Name: Sleep disturbances
Questions: Do you have trouble falling asleep because of academic worries?
Do you wake up feeling unrested and anxious about schoolwork?
Symptoms.Advice: Maintain a consistent sleep schedule and practice relaxation techniques before bed.

Rules.Action: Suggest time management strategies and mindfulness exercises.
Focus on improving study techniques and reducing distractions.
Encourage communication skills development and group engagement.
Suggest setting achievable daily goals and practicing self-compassion.
Provide resources for managing sleep hygiene and reducing nighttime anxiety.

Symptoms.Name: Overwhelming workload
Questions: Do you often feel overwhelmed by numerous work projects or tasks?
Do you struggle to balance your workload and other responsibilities?
Symptoms.Advice: Break tasks into smaller, manageable parts and prioritize tasks to reduce stress.

Symptoms.Name: Unreasonable work demands
Questions: Do you feel that your leader often assigns unreasonable tasks?
Do you find it difficult to complete work tasks due to unclear or unreasonable expectations?
Symptoms.Advice: Communicate effectively with your leader to clarify expectations and suggest feasible solutions.

Symptoms.Name: Financial stress
Questions: Do you feel that your income is insufficient to cover your expenses?
Do you experience anxiety due to financial pressures such as rent or family support?
Symptoms.Advice: Consider budgeting strategies or exploring additional income opportunities to alleviate financial stress.

Symptoms.Name: Difficulty managing emotions
Questions: Do you often feel irritable or angry at work or home?
Do you struggle to control your temper in stressful situations?
Symptoms.Advice: Practice emotional management techniques such as deep breathing, meditation, or mindfulness to improve emotional control.

Symptoms.Name: Work-life imbalance
Questions: Do you feel that work has taken over your personal life?
Do you have little time for relaxation or hobbies due to work commitments?
Symptoms.Advice: Establish clear boundaries between work and personal life, and allocate time for leisure activities.

Rules.Condition: symptom.name == 'Overwhelming workload' AND symptom.name == 'Unreasonable work demands'
Rules.Action: Suggest time management training and effective communication techniques.
Provide financial planning resources and advice on managing expenses.

Rules.Condition: symptom.name == 'Difficulty managing emotions' AND symptom.name == 'Work-life imbalance'
Rules.Action: Encourage work-life balance practices and emotional self-care routines.

Symptoms.Name: Overwhelming sadness
Questions: Do you often feel deeply sad or hopeless?
Do you find it hard to find joy in activities you once enjoyed?
Symptoms.Advice: Engage in activities that bring you joy and seek support from trusted individuals.

Symptoms.Name: Suicidal thoughts
Questions: Have you recently thought about ending your life?
Do you have a specific plan for suicide?
Symptoms.Advice: Contact a crisis hotline or a mental health professional immediately.

Symptoms.Name: Physical symptoms of distress
Questions: Do you experience severe insomnia or frequent nightmares?
Have you noticed changes in your appetite or energy levels?
Symptoms.Advice: Consider consulting a medical professional to address physical symptoms related to distress.

Symptoms.Name: Coping with loss
Questions: Have you recently lost a loved one?
Do you find it hard to cope with grief or memories of the deceased?
Symptoms.Advice: Allow yourself to grieve, share memories with others, and consider joining a support group.

Symptoms.Name: Work and financial pressure
Questions: Do you feel overwhelmed by work-related stress or financial difficulties?
Do you feel that your efforts are not recognized at work?
Symptoms.Advice: Explore stress management techniques and communicate concerns with a supervisor or trusted colleague.

Rules.Action: Recommend immediate intervention from a mental health professional.
Encourage participation in grief counseling or support groups.

Rules.Condition: symptom.name == 'Work and financial pressure' AND symptom.name == 'Physical symptoms of distress'
Rules.Action: Provide resources on managing workplace stress and improving physical well-being.

Symptoms.Name: Obsessive thoughts
Questions: Do you find yourself repeatedly thinking about the same thing, even when trying to focus on something else?
Do you feel anxious or distressed because of recurring unwanted thoughts?
Symptoms.Advice: Practice mindfulness techniques to observe your thoughts without judgment and seek professional counseling if needed.

Symptoms.Name: Compulsive behaviors
Questions: Do you feel compelled to perform certain rituals or actions repeatedly, even when you know they are unnecessary?
Do you find it difficult to stop yourself from engaging in repetitive behaviors?
Symptoms.Advice: Work with a therapist to identify triggers and develop coping strategies to reduce compulsive behaviors.

Symptoms.Name: Difficulty accepting uncertainty
Questions: Do you struggle to tolerate uncertainty in daily life?
Do you find yourself excessively seeking reassurance from others?
Symptoms.Advice: Gradually expose yourself to uncertain situations and practice accepting outcomes without seeking excessive reassurance.

Symptoms.Name: Perfectionism
Questions: Do you feel an overwhelming need to make everything perfect?
Do you find it hard to complete tasks because they never meet your standards?
Symptoms.Advice: Set realistic goals and remind yourself that imperfections are a natural part of life.

Symptoms.Name: Avoidance behaviors
Questions: Do you avoid certain places, people, or tasks because they trigger obsessive thoughts or compulsive actions?
Do you find yourself withdrawing from activities you used to enjoy?
Symptoms.Advice: Gradually confront avoided situations in a controlled manner with the support of a therapist.

Rules.Action: Recommend cognitive-behavioral therapy to address both obsessive thoughts and compulsive actions.
Encourage practicing mindfulness and tolerance for uncertainty through guided exercises.
Suggest setting achievable goals and working gradually to re-engage in avoided activities.
